data.title: Historical
data.text: Two museums. One is about Brownsville history very informative and interactive you can do crosswords, puzzles, and you can dressed up and take pictures. The other is the Stillman House and is like you go back in time as you enter the house even the smell. If you have a chance stop by :)

data.title: History
data.text: Nice historical place in Brownsville. You will learn about the history and how people lived two centuries ago in Brownsville. Interesting place to visit.

data.title: Old town Brownsville
data.text: This is one of Brownsville many historical places. It is downtown Brownsville near the Gateway Bridge. It is about an old founding family and their home. Their influence on the border settlement and growth of the Rio Grande Valley.

data.title: The museum is very cool.
data.text: I was blown away when I saw the Mann truck in the back. That made the trip to Brownsville worth it to me. The man that works at the front desk told me how they found it and where they found it, and it is very fascinating. They have interactive games for the kids and it is displayed very nicely. My wife and I loved seeing how people lived back then.

data.title: Informative and enjoyable
data.text: This museum was a pleasant surprise. Often a town's history museum is put together with well meaning volunteers, but lacks the organization of a professionally curated museum. This was very well curated. The artifacts, photographs were well captioned and tastefully and logically laid out. The temporary exhibit was Nativity scenes from multiple Hispanic countries. They were beautiful works of art. The combination of Texan and Mexican architecture and furnishings in the Stillman house was very interesting. I would suggest anyone going to Brownsville put this on their itinerary.

data.title: Brownsville History Made Easy
data.text: The Stillman House and the Heritage Resource Center adjacent to it, are by far the best place to learn about Brownsville's History. In addition to the beautifully restored home of the founder of Brownsville, Charles Stillman, there is an additional museum next door with many artifacts and relics of Brownsville's interesting history. Both museums are very nicely laid out. The Brownsville Historical Association is the custodian of not only the Stillman House and Heritage Center, but the original Town Hall at Market Square and the beautifully restored Alonso Building. A visit to any of these places is definitely worth the time.

data.title: A Great Look into early border town Texas
data.text:
You will find that this museum and preserved home are well worth your time to visit.
The museum is very well laid out and can be seen in one to two hours. The exhibits are well designed and labeled. Don't miss the old vehicle that has been named "Man." It is a great example of a very early bus. Stop by the bar and make a picture with the bartender! After you finish the museum, go next door and visit the Stillman house. You will learn a lot about the Stillmans who were very prominent in the development and growth of Brownsville. The house does a great job of displaying the culture and way of life of early times in Brownsville. Be sure and see the kitchen garden as well as the side yard garden. Doon'y forget to check out the carriage house.  Well done museum and old home site. You will enjoy this stop,

data.title: First House in Brownsville
data.text: Anyone that wants to understand the history of Brownsville needs to start at the Stillman House.  Weekly walking tours start there along with the museum and gift/history book store.

data.title: House and Museum a must
data.text: The Stillman House and the museum next door are definitely worth a visit while in Brownsville and should be promoted more because the exhibits are very well displayed and described.  The big car itself is worth the visit!

data.title: Interesting historic home
data.text: It doesn't take long to go through the Stillman House but it is well wroth a quick visit. The house is next door to the Brownsville Historic Museum and is open ofr a self-guided tour.  The surrounding grounds and garden are beautiful.

data.title: A trip back in Time
data.text: Enjoyed this trip through the Stillman House.  Everything was arranged as if you had stepped right out the present and back into that time.  I especially liked the section in the museum they had for books and picked up a couple of interesting reads.

data.title: Nice place
data.text: I really enjoyed stillman's museum.  I took my nephew and he enjoyed the exhibits.  I recommend this place for family with children.

data.title: A Wealth of Information in a little Gem of a Museum
data.text: Just happened to drive by the museum and decided to stop.  Lots of information on the history of the Valley and Brownsville.  A good presentation of the border and how it's changed (not geographically) over the years.  The Stillman House was well kept and like many other houses of that period.  One room was used for another museum type of display with more information on the family.

data.title: Muy hermoso
data.text: Aqui vine con mi familia y mi novio. Este es uno de mis museos favoritos del valle. Pagas $5 para admisión a dos museos. Vale la pena.
